11121.content:
Alright; you want Link to be the one that gets body-swapped during the events of the game. All we have to do now is to choose who he swaps with.

The most obvious choice would of course be Zelda. This would allow Link to insure that she would be safe, since Zelda would end up in his own well-trained body. Of course, it is likely that he wouldn't know how to use Zelda's own powers, which would make the task of sealing away Demise a lot more difficult...

However; if you want things to get a lot more freaky and awkward, we could cause Link to swap bodies with his own Loftwing bird! While the prospect of being able to fly under his own power might at first seem to be a boon to Link, it would soon be clear to him that his quest to find Zelda is now a lot more difficult; especially since he also has to insure that the Loftwing inside his body doesn't end up causing too many mishaps around Skyloft...

Link was working with Tetra/ Zelda's crew to keep things clean.

He heard Tetra call out, "Link! Get ready to disembark we've made it to the Temple!"

The crew began making preparations to stop the ship.

The two began exploring the depths of the temple coming across several small monsters nothing the two couldn't handle alone. As they reach the deepest part of the temple. They were greeted by an extra large Moblin which Link easily handled. They spotted a treasure chest and opened it up. Inside the chest was some gold, a map, some strange looking device and a book attached to the device.

Tetra said, "I don't care for the strange device but the gold an map will be an important asset for us to set up a New Hyrule. Move it Link! We don't have all day."

Link groaned, "I'm coming!" He picked up the small chest and managed to carry it back to the ship. Tetra immediately began looking through the map trying to pinpoint their location.

Link on the other hand was far mor interested in the device and book. He had never seen something like it before. He looked at the small rectangular device with 3 buttons on it. 115311.content:
The current hero of Hyrule, Link, was seen as an enigma to the fellow knights under Zelda and to the people he swore to protect.

To some he was just as he seemed from a glance, a noble knight who swore to protect the princess with his life. One who would rise early and sleep late doing knightly duties like deliver medicine to the sick and keep the castle clean

To others however he was anything but noble. There were rumors of him smashing pots for rupees, participating in illegal Bombchu racing, and doing any odd job for money. The times he was seen cleaning the castle were rumored to be because he was caught in the act of mischief. He must have been a hoodlum who didn't care about his knight duties at all

Neither of these views on Link were wrong, however that didn't mean either of them were completely right. These two interpretations of himself came into his mind as he practiced his swlrd techniques on a training dummy

He was devote to Hyrule, and especially to Princess Zelda. As the hero of the triforce he was prepared to give his life for her, thankfully the need hadn't come up during their last journey. He was also devote to Hyrule's people. He would always spend hours in Hyrule Castle Town listening to the people's needs and doing everything within his power to fulfill them. All the rumors about his positive deeds were true, well, nearly all of them. Link couldn't wake up at dawn if his life depended on it (Which it often felt like it did with Impa's training)

However, just because his positive rumors were correct did not mean the negative things people had said about him were completely untrue. While he enjoyed being a knight, the pay was abysmal, just enough to live. How could he go out and drink special milk on this salary? Who could really blame him for scavenging pots for extra rupees.

This desire for extra rupees was also where the rumor of him being a man who would do any odd job came from. While Link would never charge people for potion deliveries or anything that could help people, he would charge for mundane tasks like cutting lawns with his sword or walking dogs. He had also accustomed himself with Hyrule Castle Town's gambling undeground. Many of his free nights were spent trying to win big in Bombchu races or guessing the correct treasure chest

Rumors were rumors, only Link knew what was right and wrong about him and that's all he cared about. He was a devote knight with a bit of a reckless spree

His last sword strike broke the training dummy. He went to the shed where the knights kept the spares to grab another. However as he grabbed the dummy and was leaving, he noticed something strange on the ground. A case of what seemed to be around 30 bottles of a strange liquid.

Picking a bottle up, Link began to examine it. While a liquid, it's texture was closer to that of a chuchu jelly than that of a potion. Link wasn't one to think before acting, if he wanted to know what this did, there was one way to find out.

"Bottoms up" Link said to no one and began to drink the strange liquid. As soon as he did, the hero passed out. However something was strange, after passing out Link was looking at his own body! He was a ghost!

"D-did that kill me?!" Link yelled. He was panicking, did he just drink poison?! "How could I do something so stupid?!" As he looked at his unconscious body he noticed something that gave him hope. His body was still breathing! He breathed a sigh of relief "Okay, good. Not dead" Link said, he couldn't imagine ___'s reaction if they found out the hero of Hyrule had unknowingly drank poison and killed himself.

As that person entered Link's mind however, he felt his ghost body begin to travel at lightning fast speed out of his control, soon putting him in the body of.....
115311.title: Link

12132.content:
Donnel was cleaning up the barracks, he had been left behind as the other shepherds went to battle some risen. "If I were stronger they would have brought me" Donnel said to himself, depressed.

As a way to work off the frustration of not being brought along, Donnel began to swing his lance around inside the barracks. "Yeeeeeehaw- woah, no!" Donnel yelled as he misjudged his reach, his lance hitting a bookshelf which then fell forward.

"Oh no, gotta clean this all up! Frederick won't let me in'ere again if he sees this mess" Donnel said as he dropped his lance and proceeded to clean up all the books that had been knocked over.

As he picked up books, one of them caught his eye. One of Henry's books had been opened and was on a page that had a full instructions for a simple spell on it. Watching the mages of Chrom's army be able to attack from a distance often made Donnel jealous. "Henry won't mind if I just try out a spell" he justified to himself

"Woohee. This is simpler than I thought" Donnel said cheerfully as he read how to do the spell, not checking the previous page that stated what the spell would do. "All I gotta do is say what's on the page."

Donnel left the barracks, the reast of the fallen books left where they lay. He got a good distance from the Shepard's camp, just in case this spell was like an explosion or something.

"Here we go!" Donnel said before reciting the spell as it was written "Sreiht hyie ydob ym hctiws!"

As soon as Donnel finished talking, he felt as if the whole world was being pulled out from under his feet. He saw the environment around him move at a flashing speed, however he was not moving himself, rather his soul was! Within a few seconds he saw a familar group, his fellow shepards coming back from their battle against Risen. His spirit flew straight forward until he flew into the body of an ally who happened to have been standing directly parallel to his old one, albeit miles away.

Whose body did Donnel end up in?
12132.title: Donnel

121321.content:
Donnel's spirit smashed into Tharja's body. 'Tharja' stared into space for a while, looking utterly confused with where she was or what she was doing. Then she shaily brought a hand up to her face, her expression turned to one of pure panic. "WHAT IN TARNATION?!" 'She' yelled out, with more emotion than Tharja ever put into her voice

Donnel looked at his new purple nails in terror, this couldn't be happening, there's no is that spell had put him into someone else's body, right? He had to be dreaming "Just done got ta wake myself up" he said, flinching at hearing Tharja's voice come out of his mouth. He grabbed his new, long hair with his hands and tugged hard "Ow ow ow ow ow!" It hurt, that meant he wasn't dreaming!

Donnel took a gulp, this whole time he had been looking forward, but he knew he had to look down at his new self eventually. Looking down, unfortunately as expected, he was greeted by Tharja's generous cleavage and the rest of her body, barely covered in what Donnel would hesitate to even call an outfit.

"This here is all that there darn spellbook's fault!" Donnel stomped with Tharja's heeled shoe. wait, the spellbook! That could turn him back to normal! Donnel look around him, thankfully none of the other Shepard's had noticed 'Tharja's outburst, in fact, they had all walked ahead, leaving him behind. "Phew, I done might be able ta keep this here all secret"

Donnel began to walk in the direction of where his body would be, although to call it walking would be generous. Because of his new center of gravity and Tharja's heeled shoes, he took big stomps while keeping his arms stretched in front of him, expecting to trip. If anyone saw him like this, they would think he looked ridiculous

Unfortunately for him, the long, hard steps he took only accentuated the foreign bouncing sensation he felt on his new chest. He wanted out of this body as soon as possible. By the time he had reached where he left his body, the sun had already long set. It easily took him three times longer to get here than normally walking would.

Looking to the exact location where his body was, Donnel found
121321.title: Tharja

1213212.content:
Donnel didn't know whether to breathe a sigh of relief or panic when he saw his body laying down in the field completely empty. If Tharja was aware he was in her body, Naga knows what she would do to him. However, this also meant he wouldn't be able to rely on her to reverse this mistake.

"Golly, I shoulda never have done messed with Henry's book" Donnel said to himself as he kicked Tharja's leg. He needed to fix this quick, but how? The easiest way would be to ask Henry to change him back, however would Henry be willing to? Asking Henry to cast a spell might be more trouble than it's worth. Henry would turn someone into a frog for fun if you gave him permission to cast a spell on you

Donnel of course knew there was another option right now too. Even if it might be an example of not learning his lesson. He now had access to Tharja's tent and all her belongings, surely she would have a spell that could fix all of this, right? And if he managed to fix it all on his own, no one would even know he was messing with Henry's stuff.

As the wind blew and made him shiver in Tharja's outfit, Donnel chose to

12511.content:
Byleth was sitting at their desk in their bedroom grading the students work for the day. It wasn't bad, but could be better. An extra lance tutorial here, another horseback lesson there, and overall everyone needed work in authority, but they were still processing. Byleth was proud of their students. Byleth was just staring blank faced as always at the papers when a voice came out of nowhere. "Rejoice! For I have more good news for you!"

Byleth sighed, Sothis, the Goddess who shared their headspace seemed to have something to say, and she was very excited to share the news, whatever it was.

"Don't just sit there with that blank look of yours, be happy, for I have recalled an ability that I have and now you can use it as well." Sothis said with her usual air of superiority. Byleth wanted to just brush this off, but her time travel ability had saved Byleth and their students more times than they could count, so Byleth put the grading quill down and listened to what Sothis had to say.

"I have recall the power of Transferance! You now have the ability to place your mind into the body of whoever you see."

"..." Was all Byleth felt like responding with, this certainly sounded interesting, but how could it help as a teacher? The use wasn't very obvious.

"You dolt. Of course the use is obvious. You can swap into the body of an enemy on the battlefield and toss their best weapons away leaving them for easy pickings." Byleth sighed at Sothis' complaints. Byleth tended to forget that Sothis could read their mind. So Byleth though loudly in Sothis' direction, "Yes, it seems useful and I'll have to use it, but I'm more worried about how I can use this to help me teach my students, that's my priority right now."

"Well...just use it! And find out, and don't worry about how the students will react, when you swap I'll be the one in charge of your body unless you ask otherwise. The person you swap with will be in an unconscious state within our subconscious."

"Well, I guess that's one less thing I need to worry about." Byleth said getting up, Byleth decided to go ahead and try this crazy power on one of his students. Perhaps a way to help teach them would pop up by doing this.

"One last thing!" Sothis said as Byleth stood. Byleth waited for the response but Sothis seemed almost embarrassed to say. Finally after a minute Sothis said, "I kind of forgot, are you a boy or a girl?"

Byleth sighed, Sothis practically asked this once a month at this point, it was rather annoying. Perhaps one day they'd say the opposite just to mess with Sothis.
12511.title: Byleth is awakened to a new power

choices: Byleth is in charge of the Golden Deer
125111.content:
Byleth left his room and began the walk to the house classroom where he could probably find at least one student there he could test his new Transferance power on. As he walked the spirit of the Goddess Sothis floated along side him. This was odd since she normally took 'physical' form that only he could see inside of his room.

"If for whatever reason you want the person you swap with to be aware of what has happened with the Transferance Swap all you have to do is tell me and I can make it happen."

Byleth nodded subtly, after all he didn't want to be seen talking to a little girl he's the only one knew was there.

"So, do you have anyone in mind you'd like to swap with?" Sothis asked obviously not leaving Byleth alone. Byleth sighed and made sure no one was watching him. He quickly whispered to Sothis, "Someone from my house obviously, I'm trying to use this as a learning tool for my teaching."

"Ah, yes...of course." Sothis said a little unsure. Byleth squinted at the green haired goddess. Byleth whispered, "You don't know what house I teach, do you?"

"Me not know something? Of course not! I am the goddess Sothis! I know all I ned to know of this world!" Sothis said with her prideful child like voice which became less confident all of the sudden, "But...if I didn't know...what would tell me your house was?"

Byleth sighed a the goddess and revealed what house he was the leader of.
125111.title: You are Male Byleth

1251111.content:
“Ah, Yes! The Black Eagles!” Sothis said before quickly changing her tone. “I mean, of course you do.”

Byleth just syed and went on to his classroom. Only two students where in there, as class wasn’t supposed to start for another ten minutes.

“Hi, professor!”, Dorothea said as Byleth came in. Bernadetta was the other student in the classroom, but she just dug her head into a book.

“So, it looks like it’s going to be one of them.” Sothis said.

Byleth thought for a second. He could probably get Dorothea on board with the swap, and allow her to take his body. But he could help Bernadetta a great deal if he swapped with her. Of course, he’d have to make Bernadetta unaware of the swap, though. Byleth thought hard before deciding that he would swap with...
1251111.title: Byleth teaches the Black Eagles

choices: Byleth decides to go after one of the other Golden Deer students
1251113.content:
Byleth entered the Golden Deer classroom, much to his surprise everyone was there. Hilda and Claude were in a corner probably scheming something. Lysithea and Ignatz had their noses in some books. Raphael and Leonie were having an impromptu sparring session. And Lorenz was trying to cheer the ever gloomy Marianne up with some tea.

Byleth was very eager to try out his new Transferance power, but using it in a group this large seemed like a bad idea, he decided to wait until the groups were smaller. Eventually after breaking a chair Leonie and Raphael went off to the actual training grounds to train. The noise got to be too much for Ignatz and Lysithea who went to the library. Marianne ran off to the stables and Lorenz being a 'noble gentlemen' followed leaving Hilda and Claude alone with their schemes and/or gossip.

Byleth looked at the student leader of the golden deer and his usual partner in crime. Byleth had to admit, Claude was the hardest nut to crack in the house, hell maybe the entire school, and if he swapped with Claude he might be able to get some insight in how the lord thought first hand. On the other hand, what a better way to get to know Claude than to switch with Hilda, she seemed to be the only person Claude had some degree of openness with...Byleth thought. If he swapped with her perhaps the mystery of Claude would begin to unravel.
1251113.title: Byleth is in charge of the Golden Deer

choices: Hilda was going to enter the White Harron Cup to show up a cocky Dorathea
Hilda was going to distract Dimitri while Claude played a prank
Hilda's on kitchen duty, a prime position for pranking the masses
12511132.content:
Much like the power of the Divine Pulse Byleth could use the go back in time, this power of Transference came very naturally. Byleth concentrated on Hilda as she whispered something Claude and Byleth felt himself suddenly feel light as a feather. Byleth saw himself leaving his body and flying towards the pink haired lazy powerhouse and the next thing Byleth knew he was looking up at Claude who's confident and cocky look wavered for a moment with concern. "You ok Hilda? You looked lightheaded for a second? You about to pass out from excitement from the plan?"

Byleth shook his head seeing two pink pigtails wave in and out of his vision. There were other body parts such as said pigtails that could be very distracting but Byleth focused on Claudes deep green eyes. "Oh, it's nothing Claude, I just...spaced out for a second." Byleth looked at the classroom doorway and saw...himself standing there with a cocky grin that he recognized from seeing on the child goddesses face. It seemed she was right and was in control of his body while Hilda was asleep inside him or something. "I just wanted to make sure we weren't overheard." Byleth said lowering his voice to a whisper.

"Who? Teach?" Claude said, "Sure Teach might try to dissuade us from our little plan, but he won't actually try and stop us. It's not like we're going to blow up the school or something." Claude laughed as Byleth looked unsure, "We're not blowing up the school...right?"

"Of course not, it's just a silly little prank to see the look on someone's face when we get the better of them. But Hilda, you're going to have to not be lazy and put in a little bit of work. Okay?"

Claude looked at Byleth with his mischievous smile, Byleth could really see how he always managed to get out of trouble with teachers and students, he was so darn charming, and maybe it was Hilda's body but Claudes charms seemed even more powerful. "All right, just so I'm clear on everything, what's the plan again."

Claude sighed, but didn't let this hiccup stop him from explaining his little plan to Hilda and what her key role in it was.
12511132.title: Byleth swaps himself into Hilda

choices: Byleth swaps back and offers to teach Hilda to dance
Byleth decides to stay as Hilda for a little while
Byleth swaps Claude into Hilda's body
125111321.content:
Claude began to explain his plan and reasonings Hilda, who he didn't know was actually Byleth, "You know better than anyone how cocky and confident Dorathea has been about the White Herron Cup dancing competition. She's been bragging about how she was one of the best dancers at her opera company and quite frankly, that just makes me want to beat her all the more. But I've got two left feet and let's face it, the judges usually give it to the girls so you're the best option Hilda. What do you say we show some good old fashion Golden Deer spirit and make sure you win this thing? I promise not to bug you for a whole month if you do this and win."

Byleth thought about this. As far as evil scheming plots go, this was actually pretty innocent if not downright pleasant. If Hilda won the White Herron Cup it would probably help her out not he battlefield and also give the Golden Deer House some extra prestige. Byleth could swap back and offer some encouragement to Hilda to help her overcome her natural laziness.

Then again, Byleth didn't really want to admit this, but this sounded like fun. He'd never really danced before being raised as a mercenary by Jeralt. The idea of dancing in front of a panel of judges was a very interesting thought. And it might be a good way to get closer to his Golden Deer Students if he was one for a few days before the competition.

But there was another option, if Claude wanted to win this so bad, maybe he could do it...as Hilda. With some assistance from Byleth and the Transferance power. It was a prank worthy of Claude himself and Byleth was very tempted to go through with it.
125111321.title: Hilda was going to enter the White Harron Cup

choices: Revealed he actually found the body switch exciting and hilarious
Was completely distressed by the body switch
1251113213.content:
"You know.." Byleth began "If you want something done, you should do it yourself" they grinned and began focusing on Claude

"Come on Hilda you know if I..." Claude began "...could I would" Hilda's body finished. Byleth stared at Hilda's body, now in Claude's body. Claude began pulling at his new pig tails in shock "what did you do, Hilda?" He asked flabbergasted

"Not Hilda, professor" Byleth began to lecture about what was going on "You know full well how lazy Hilda is, yet you were going to force her to learn how to dance in a few days just to show someone up" Byleth said sternly, he didn't actually mind what Claude and Hilda were doing, but he wanted to seem like he had an actual reason for putting Claude in Hilda's body

"But the judges will favor girls, there's no way I could-" Claude began to talk back but then realized what Byleth was saying "Wait, you want me to dance in Hilda's body?!" Claude nearly shouted

"Wait, stay in her body until then?!" Claude exclaimed "but the competition isn't for a few more days!"

"You don't know how to dance either right, you can spend those few days learning." Byleth smirked. "In fact we'll start your lessons later this afternoon"

"But do I really have to stay as Hilda for days?" Claude asked

"Of course, you'll need to get used to how her body moves, we can't have you failing to dance because you're not used to her body." And with that final statement Byleth began to walk away in Claude's body, leaving Claude alone in his new body

Once left alone in Hilda's body Claude....
1251113213.title: Byleth swaps Claude into Hilda's body

choices: Follow Claude at Manuela's dance lessons
Follow Hilda as she plots a prank
Follow Byleth as he helps(?) more people with his swapping power
12511132131.content:
Once left alone with Hilda's body there was only one thing on Claude's mind. He doubled over laughing, "Ok, all right. I know when I'm beat. Good one Teach, you're just full of surprises." Claude sat back in a chair and kicked Hilda's legs up on the desk and began to let his mind wonder, but that wasn't going to last long, "Claude!" A voice came from the doorway. Claude fell out of his chair in surprise upon hearing his own voice call out his own name at him. "What are you doing?"

Instinctivly Claude cried out in Hilda's voice, "It wasn't me!" And stood up and started patting the dirt off of his uniform. "Don't touch my body like that, you've got to be more lady like if you're going to clean yourself off," Claudes body said shaking his head. Claude raised an eyebrow and asked, "So Teach put you in my body, is the right Hilda?"

He of course used his power as the archbishop to ensure no one else was present so he could relax in utter peace. "Never really had any privacy before, between the mercenaries, students, and Sothis. A girl can really get used to this sort of treatment," he chuckled to himself, grinning a bit as he snaked a hand under the towel, groping at Rhea's chest.

The country was at peace at the moment, so a bit of slacking off could be fine. She herself didn't have to make that many appearances. He could delegate quite a bit to Seteth at well. After a few moments, he had on her undergarments and a casual white dress, and made his way out of the sauna. The guards gave a stiff salute as he exited, obviously not used to seeing the Archbishop so close up and even less accustomed to seeing her dressed so casually. "Oh don't be so uptight. I appreciate your diligence. Until next time~" He waved away with a sweet smile. His voice was a dry monotone, but Rhea's had a songlike and calming affect. While his voice commanded attention for sounding strong and affirmative, hers sounded gentle and caring. It was quite the contrast, but it seemed to always have an effect.

Humming to himself, he made his way back to upper floors of the monastery, where he could get to finishing up Rhea's duties for the day. A few heads turned as the casually dressed Archbishop passed by, but just as many people ignored her, likely not even realizing she was the Bishop.

What happened then?

While the other Deer scattered across the monastery, determined to find the real Archbishop, one decided to go straight to the source of the issue altogether. They had less noble motives than the others however - they wanted to try body swapping too!

Poor Marianne had been struggling to find any joy in life since losing her family. The Margrave Edmund had sent her off to the monastery presumably just to get rid of her, or atleast thats what her innate pessimism told her. People kept telling her to be herself, but that didn't mean anything. They didn't know anything about her. She always thought that her best shot at being happy was the exact opposite - become someone else.

And now that was a possibility. And so, she mustered up all the courage she had to go speak with the professor and ask if they could use the power on her. Even if just for a while, she could be free of her family's curse, and the curse of being herself.

What she wasn't sure about though was who to confront. The professor supposedly in Rhea's body, or the person who had been in the professor's body these past few class sessions?
12511132131113211311323.title: One of the Deer goes to Byleth directly - they ...

choices: "How would you like being the Archbishop for a bit?"
125111321311132113113231.content:
Byleth had gotten back to enjoying his time as the Archbishop, grabbing snacks from the cafeteria, picking his favorite swords from the armory for later, and otherwise delegating to Seteth anything of importance. As the sun began to hang low, however, he went to make his way back to Rhea's quarters when he was surprised by one of the more meek students approaching him.

"Uh, Lady...Rhea?"

"Yes, Marianne? Is there something you need?" Byleth asked, surprised Marianne of all people would approach her.

"Uh, I had to know. Is it true?"

"... is what true?"

"That you know you're not really the Archbiship?"

Byleth's eyes went wide, surprised someone had come right out with it already. "Where did you hear such a thing?"

",,,Claude and Hilda, ma'am. They said you were really the professor?"

"Hmmm..." Byleth supposed he shouldn't have been surprised. They already knew about his power - of course they'd be on the lookout for something like this. They were smart kids after all. Will have to get them back for telling their fellow classmates though. "Come with me to my office, Marianne, we'll discuss it there."

"Oh... uh... alright."

---

"...so you want me to switch you with someone then?"

"Yes, please."

"Hmm. Any reason?"

Marianne looks to the side. "I'm not... a very happy person. There are people out there who envy me, or say I'm lucky, since I'm a noble. But I don't care. If they envy me, they can have my life. I'd like to live more free."

A frown came over Byleth's face. It hurt to hear one of his students was so depressed. "Well, I have to hand it to you, it took a lot of confidence to just come and ask me. So... why not?"

"R-really!? You'll do it?"

Byleth nodded. "Atleast for a while, just to satisfy your curiosity."

The slightest of smiles broke onto Marianne's face. "Thank you Arch- I mean Professor. But, who will you switch me with?"
125111321311132113113231.title: She seeks Byleth as Rhea

1251113213111321131132312.content:
Byleth gave some thought on who to swap Marianne with "Well, most students are out of the question. If being nobility is part of what's making you depressed, I can't just make you another noble. Hmmm"

Who to swap her with, there were non nobles at Gareg Mach. Who to swap her with though? Byleth wanted to keep a close eye on her while she was someone else, if she was feeling just as bad, or even worse as someone else he wanted the ability to swap her back at a moment's notice

Byleth's first thought was Cyril. The past few days he had been able to rely on Cyril for minor conveniences could as of him as the archbishop. Keeping an eye on Marianne if she became him would be a simple task. He could also rely on Cyril to keep the power of Transference a secret if he told him. Cyril respected lady Rhea significantly more than most people, he would walk on hot coals if she told him too. If 'she' told him to keep his mouth shut about this power, he would do so

Another person Byleth could keep his eye on if Marianne were to become them was Seteth. Seteth's duties would always require him to return to his office afterward, if Marianne were to become him Byleth could periodically check in on her throughout the day. However swapping her with Seteth came with the danger of Seteth learning of this power and possibly suspecting that Rhea hadn't been herself for the past few days.

Looking at Marianne who was silently waiting patently Byleth chose to swap her with...

1251113213111321132.content:
"As for what it entails...." Byleth began to tell Seteth, still making up these rules as he was going along. "Is that all female students shall dress as maids...and all male students shall dress as butlers. And they shall serve their professors." Seteth looked very confused and perhaps even a little skeptical. Byleth decided he needed to come up with rationalization for his lie. "This is done to...show the nobility the hardships of the people and is meant to instill understanding and hard work upon them. I think this is an excellent idea to bring back for the students."

Byleth was proud of his lie, and Seteth didn't suspect enough to counter 'Lady Rhea'. And so Seteth went to work. He added the new 'celebrations' to the calendar. Ordered all of the needed uniforms. And made sure all the students knew that this was not optional. As Seteth did this, Byleth and Sothis were laughing in the archbishops room as an angry Rhea fish swam around a nice little tank Cyril had built for her.

Meanwhile with the students of Garage Mach, most of the students accepted this new celebration with groans and complaints, but two people with an eye for pranks had a good idea of what was going on.

"Do you think the Professor would actually go that far?" Hilda asked sitting in a ladylike fashion in Claude's body. "Oh I have no doubt Teach is capable, he's got a devious mind behind the stone face. And don't sit like that, you don't see me sitting spread leg or anything." Claude said with his legs crossed like a lady, although the reason for that was mainly because Manuela had been berating him all day to be more ladylike for the White Herron Cup dance competition.

Hilda spread her legs and stuck her tongue out at her body, "Well, we could just sit back and act like good little butlers and maids..."

"Or we could do something about it." Claude finished Hilda's thought with a glimmer in Hilda's eyes.

They want to be swapped back before the Cup
They want Byleth to swap around another pair of students for a prank
12511132131113211323.content:
It was a relatively low key next few days at Gerreg Mach Monestary. Byleth knew he had to stay in Rhea's body or else Rhea would undo his student servant holiday plans. Plus he figured he'd caused enough chaos in the school and didn't feel the need to cause any more...for now. No, he spend the last few days mostly trying not to trip on Rhea elaborate dresses and also being followed around by Seteth who updated him on the political Fodlan landscape. Sothis in Byleth's body usually stopped by once a day to update him on how teaching students was boring to her so she was messing around with the lesson plan by trying to teach Raphael light magic and Lysithea axes and how much of a disaster that had been so far.

But at last, the big day of the White Herron Cup had arrived. Byleth was awakened on the much anticipated day by knocking on the archbishop's door at the crack of dawn. "Oh your archbishopness. It's time to start the day.". A guy's sing songy voice came through the door. Byleth got up and opened the door and was surprised at what he saw even if he'd instructed it. Claude and Hilda were standing there still in each other's bodies with big smiles on their faces. Hilda's body was wearing a rediculously pink maid outfit with a large bustle under the skirt. While Claude's body was wearing a golden yellow tailored suit. Whoever did the rush job on the outfits did a great job.

Not waiting to be invited in, Claude and Hilda entered while giving an over the top bow and curtsy. "Oh great and might Rhea! The two of us have been oh so lucky and fortunate enough to win a lottery drawing to have the pleasure of being your personal servants for the day. Now don't you worry your holy head about anything. Let us do all the work." Byleth was slightly off put by how willing these two usual trouble makers were when it came to being servants for a day, but figured they were just rolling with the punches so any doubts went away as Hilda used Claude's hands to massage Byleth's shoulders.

Byleth sat back and enjoyed being pampered. Although it wasn't as comfortable as he'd hoped. Hilda put a bunch of painful pins in his head to make sure Rhea's headpiece didn't move, the juice that Claude gave him for breakfast had a weird aftertaste to it, and the shoes they selected had ridiculously big heels that were difficult to walk around in. Things were going well until Hilda said, "Ew, look at this disgusting fish, I'll just toss this into the lake for you, or maybe cook it up for dinner."

"NO!" Byleth said practically tripping over his heels and dress to stop her from touching the actual Rhea.

Claude chucked and twirled Hilda's pigtails as he said, "Let me guess, that's the actual Rhea, Teach?"

Byleth's eyes went wide, then he realized of course, they knew about his Transferance swap power and must have figured everything out, "Ok, it so. But I swear I'll swap back after the White Herron Cup."

"Oh you'll definitely want to swap back, especially after you start feeling the impact of this stuff by tonight." Claude said shaking a bottle of clear liquid. Byleth's eyes went wide, "Did you poison me? Did you poison the archbishops body?!"

"Relax, it won't kill her, just make her throw up a little. Just something to encourage you to make sure you give her body back. I'm sure throwing up for a few days will be a small price to pay for her getting her body returned to her." Claude continued making the bottle disappear with a little slight of hand.

"So...you've got me." What is it the two of you want?" Byleth asked his students who he had to admit, he was a little proud of for getting one over on him. Claude and Hilda smiled as they revealed their plan.
12511132131113211323.title: The day of the White Herron Cup arrives

choices: Byleth enters and wins the cup
Byleth enters and loses the cup
125111321311132113231.content:
"So, my lady" Hilda began to explain in Claude's body "Thanks to the lessons this big oaf no longer has two left feet"

"-but there's no way I'll be able to beat Dorothea in the Herron cup!" Claude finished

Byleth crossed his arms, he had to admit, he doubted Claude would have much of a chance even if he was super diligent in his dance lessons. However maybe it was because he was talking to Hilda's body, he suspected he didn't take every lesson very seriously "And what do you want me to do?"

"Well you can swap bodies professor! Dorothea wouldn't be able to beat me if she wasn't actually the one dancing!" Claude's eyes gleamed from his ingenious idea

"If you become Dorothea and lose on purpose, there's no way we can lose!" Hilda was excited at the prospect of winning her actually needing to put in a large amount of effort

Byleth immediately noticed something they had overlooked in the plan "Okay, you have an idea for beating Dorothea, but what about the Blue Lions entree?"

"Pssh" Claude waved a dismissive hand. "That class is full of people who don't know the definition of fun. All I need to do is put passion into my moves and the judges will pick me over them."

Byleth thought it over, this could work. Although he wanted his house to win fair and square, that seemed like an impossible request for Claude and Hilda. Evening the odds wouldn't be that big a crime

However, Byleth was also annoyed with the two. They strutted in here first thing in the morning and ruined his experience in this body, and now they were making demands of him. Fine, if they wanted a prank war, they will get one "Alright, fine. I'll swap with Dorothea for the cup-"

"You're the best, teach!" Claude interrupted Byleth before he was done talking

"-however." Byleth said sternly, Claude and Hilda gulped fearing what this meant. "If you don't win, neither of you will be going back to your own bodies for at least a week."

Claude's fears were slept away "Well, I think I can handle being Hilda's for a little while longer"

Byleth chuckled "Oh, I didn't mean Hilda. I can make you whoever I want, and trust me there are much worse people to be then a pretty young lady. Like an archbishop who's about to spend a day vomiting, or a teacher" Byleth smirked as the fear in Claude and Hilda's faces grew.

Byleth tried to make a dramatic exit, however it was more comical than anything else as he had to make ridiculously big steps to move in the insanely high heels the two had given him


-------

"And that's what happened" Byleth in his body explained to the goddess in his head

"Riiiiiight." Sothis replied paying half attention "and what exactly do you plan to do with that?"

Byleth looked in the corner of the classroom, he knew he couldn't neither let Rhea back in her body and risk her ruining all of this nor could he have Sothis become Rhea, he didn't want Dorothea in his body during the cup for this plan to work. That left him with 1 option. Let the fish stay in Rhea's body for a bit. "We'll turn the archbishop back later, for now the fish can be her. Let's just....make sure the door stays locked"

Byleth put out a plate of fruit, to which the fish in Rhea's body ran over to the plater and began consuming. Byleth took this chance to run out of the room and lock the door, praying that the fish wouldn't figure out how to open a window and escape

Making his way over to the room where the cup was being held, Byleth saw Claude made it before him and was standing with the other two contestants. Dorothea of course, but also Annette from the Blue Lions house.

Looking at Dorothea, Byleth could tell this was already rigged in her favor in one way. All three contestants were wearing maid uniforms of course, but Dorothea had taken the time to embroider a pattern that seemed to sparkle like gold, she already seemed more dazzling than the other two contestants.

Not wanting to waste any more time, Byleth focused hard on Dorothea to initiate another Transference

choices: Annette wins, now what bodies should Byleth give Claude and Hilda
Before the vote is cast, there is a surprise attack on Garreg Moch
1251113213111321132312.content:
Byleth felt himself flying towards Dorethea as she excersizing in preparation for the Cup and the next thing he knew, he was the one mid stretch. Byleth stood up and mentally prepared himself to throw the competition. After all, if he wanted to rig it so Claude and Hilda would lose, he'd just let Dorathea dance on her own. Now all Claude had to do was beat Annette, but that was up to him and his dancing in Hilda's body. Claude apparently noticed Dorathea's change in demeanor as he gave Byleth a little wink and a nod.

About a minute later, Alois, the jovial Knight of Seros stood before the gathering of teachers and students dressed as maids and said, "Ladies and gentlemen! My sincerest apologies for the wait, but my room just got a good cleaning thanks to some of the students of the academy," Alois motioned to Caspar who was wearing a light blue butler suit and gave an enthusiastic thumbs up. "I swear my room hasn't been that clean since I swept my wife off of her feet. Get it. Swept!" The silence was deafening, but that didn't stop Alois from continuing. "Thank you for gathering here on the eve of the highly anticipated ball to bear witness to this year's academy wide dance competition. The White Heron Cup!" There was a smattering of applause from the crowd eager to see the dancing. Alois explained he, Manuela, and Shamir would be the judges this year and went over the rules.

Byleth was half paying attention when Claude whispered, "Good luck Teach, or should I say bad luck? Would that be too rude?"

Byleth rolled Dorathea's eyes and when Dorathea's name was called he made his way to the dance floor. Byleth did a few elegant movements, but made sure to trip over his feet a few times, which wasn't difficult in the heels Dorathea had decided to wear that day. There was a polite applause once Byleth finished, but people were clearly disappointed. When he went back beside Annette and 'Hilda' he whispered to the pink headed girl, "It's all on you now." And he concentrated on his body again and used Transference to give Dorathea her body back. He looked at the slightly confused girl who didn't quite recall dancing.

A few minutes later Annette and 'Hilda' had their chances to dance. Byleth was pleasantly surprised, apparently Manuela's dance lessons had worked, Claude moved very gracefully and lady like during the competition. He actually had a good chance of winning it all. But finally it was time for the judges to make their decision. Alois gave his vote to Annette of the Blue Lions. Manuela votes for 'Hilda' of the Golden Deer house leaving Shamir as the tie breaking vote.

Shamir began to speak about how she was voting for, the room went silent as the vote could go either way "Well, they both did a better job than the comedy act Dorothea performed." Shamir said bluntly

"Comedy act?! I haven't even-" Dorothea began to speak out but then put a hand over her own mouth, or rather Byleth put his hand over his mouth after transferring bodies quickly. He was still getting gazes from Dorothea's outburst however "Haven't ever seen dancers as good as them before" he quickly thought of an excuse

Rhea hands down her judgement upon Byleth

125111321311132113231223.content:
With his hands around Claude and Hilda's shoulders, Byleth was letting them just squirm a little bit while he thought about what body he could put the two of them in, when Byleth felt another hand on his own, or rather Dorathea's shoulder. Byleth turned and saw Catherine standing there. "Just because the White Heron Cup is over doesn't mean the Student Servant holiday is. Dorathea, I want you to clean up the dance hall. There are scuff marks all over the floor."

"But I need to..." Byleth tried to start, but Catherine cut him off, "No buts, respect the holiday rediscovered by the great Lady Rhea."

Byleth could hear the laughing of Claude and Hilda as they made a break for it out of the room. Byleth looked up at Catherine and considered using Transferance on her, but figured it would be a little too messy. He made this mess with the student servant thing, he might as well clean it up, both figuratively and literally. So the rest of the night he spent on his hands and knees in Dorathea's decorative red maid outfit cleaning the floor and grumbling to himself about people littering and not respecting school grounds.

After the cleaning was done and the sun was setting, Byleth knew he had to tie up some loose ends. He went back to his room where Sothis was more than happy to laugh at his misfortune telling him he got what was coming to him. He swapped back into his body giving a very confused Dorathea her body back, but thankfully she didn't ask any questions.

Then the not fun part. Byleth went back to the Archbishop's room and was met with quite a sight. The fish in Rhea's body had successfully made quite a mess with clothing and papers strewn about everywhere and the archbishop's body was currently rolling around on the ground making weird noises. "Yeah...I really need to fix this before it gets bad. Hope the archbishop is in a forgiving mood. Byleth was starting to really get the hang of the Transferance ability. In a matter of seconds he had swapped into Rhea's body, then into the fish, and one jump later back into his own putting everyone in the proper bodies.

The archbishop stood up and seemed too mad to speak. "In all of my years on Fodlan, I have never seen such an abuse of power. I swear that I'll get you back for this. I'm going to..." But what Rhea was going to do, Byleth didn't find out. There was a very loud rumble that seemed to come from Rhea's stomach and her face dropped.

"Ah, that was probably the stuff that Claude and Hilda drugged me with while in your body." Byleth said trying not to laugh at the look of discomfort on Rhea's face.

"I'll...I'll talk with you tomorrow!" And Rhea ran off to her personal bathroom while Byleth went back to his room. Tomorrow wasn't going to be pleasant for him, but at least he wasn't the only one living in fear as Claude and Hilda were themselves growing more and more nervous in their rooms at what tomorrow would bring.


After all, tomorrow wasn't just going to be a day of reckoning for the pranksters, it was the day of the 995's Garreg Moch ball, when all the students would put on their best uniforms and dance the night away. Some couples would even meet at the Goddess Tower and profess feelings towards each other. Byleth went to sleep with Sothis laughing in his head and fear of Rhea in his heart as he drifted off to sleep wondering what tomorrow might bring.

1251113213111321132312231.content:
As the dancing and pageantry of the Ball began inside the walls of Garreg Moch, outside at the goddess tower, Claude and Hilda continued their efforts to hide from Byleth who was looking to handing out punishments after being scolded by Rhea all day. Hiding in the shadows of the Goddess Tower, the meddlesome duo decided they were alone and it was safe to talk.

"I can't believe that you actually poisoned the archbishop of the Church of Seros." Hilda said holding in a giggle.

"Hey, you were in on the plan too. And besides, Teach was in her body at the time so technically I only poisoned my teacher. And it should just give Rhea a bit of a tummy ache for. a few days...I think. I probably should have tested it more." The two friends giggled but shushed each other when they heard noises. Making sure not to be seen the two saw Ferdinand (von Ayer) and Dorathea sneaking into an abandoned classroom holding hands.

"I knew it! I knew Dorathea liked him! I bet that noble hating stuff is overblown too." Hilda said fist pumping.

"Yeah, but who knows, if Byleth catches them, they might be the ones we have to swap with for our punishment." Claude said with a sigh. There was a few moments of silence. "Would it be that bad if we swapped with people who were going out?" Hilda asked breaking the ice. Claude was surprised by this sentiment. "Well, it wouldn't be a bad thing. I mean, it would actually probably be nice to be out holding hands with you...and other things." Both Claude and Hilda did some uncharacteristic blushing. Claude quickly added, "But don't tell your brother I said that. He'd kill me."

"Well, he's your brother right now." Hilda joked. There was another bit of awkward silence before Claude said, "You know, if Byleth actually wanted to punish us, he'd swap us with people who don't, or can't hang out together. I definitely wouldn't want that."

"Me either. That sounds like the worst thing he could do to us." Hilda said. A few more minutes of awkward silence passed as the party seemed to beginning to die down inside.

"You know," The ever plotting Claude said with Hilda's most confident tone. "There's one thing we could do to make sure Byleth can't punish us and separate us."

"What's that?"

"We could just drop out of school and run away together." Claude casually said.

"What?!" Hilda said, "Don't even joke about that, we'd be stuck in each other's bodies forever if we did that."

"Yeah...but there are worse things to do. We could travel the world, I could show you Almyra and you could take me to meet your brother."

"That's silly, that's the kind of things lovers do before they get married."

"Yeah, yeah it is." Claude said plainly. Hilda just stared blankly at her old face which was smiling a smug smile. "Claude von Riegan if you are joking or scheming right now..."

"I'm not joking," Claude said, "But I'm always scheming. You know that, and there's no one I would rather scheme with for the rest of my life. I came here to find a way to change the world, and I'm still not sure how I'm going to do that, but I've found someone I want to change the world with. What do you say Hilda, do you want to get out of here and take on the world?"

Hilda didn't even hesitate as she kissed Claude beneath the Goddess Tower. No more needed to be said as the two snuck off into the night.
1251113213111321132312231.title: Claude and Hilda Meet at the Goddess Tower

12511132131113211323122311.content:
Claude von Riegan and Hilda Valentine Goneril:
News spread of the eloping of Claude von Riegan and Hilda Valentine Goneril like wildfire. Their surprise exit the night of the 995th Garreg Moch Ball would become the stuff of legend. The two would wed in a small village in Alliance territory. But despite leaving Garreg Moch, the two did not abandon their duties. Hilda would go on to take Claude's place as the leader of the Alliance and with Claude as advisor, Hilda would go on to create unprecedented relationships with Almyra which would strength both continents. The two would have a very large family who's lineage would go on to dominate the Fodlan and Almyra political stage with their schemes.

Byleth:
Byleth would eventually leave Garreg Moch after 5 years having gotten bored with teaching and getting punishment work from Rhea. No one knew exactly why Rhea made Byleth do so much work, but someone overheard the Archbishop muttering something about a fish as the cause of their rift. Byleth would go on to become an advisor for Claude and Hilda. He'd offered to switch the two back, but they turned down the offer. Byleth would also offer as a wedding gift to switch with Claude and be the one to give birth to their children for him. Byleth would eventually very much regret this offer.

Manuela:
She's still single and complains about it nightly with a beer in hand.

Rhea:
Rhea worked amicably with Byleth for years before Byleth left, but Byleth left his mark behind. It turns out Claude's poison had a much more severe effect on the Archbishops unique body. She'd spend years dealing with stomach issues. But inadvertently this would help Rhea. As one day Edelgard came across the Archbishop in distress. Edelgard saw a humanity and vulnerably in Rhea she didn't think possible and glanced within herself. She determined the church wasn't the problem with Fodlan, it was Those Who Slither In The Dark. She'd go on to lead a cool named Black Eagle Strike Force in order to take them down and free Fodlan from their clutches.

"We want you to swap us back." Claude replied, crossing Hilda's arms with a smirk.

"Yeah, being a guy feels really weird." Hilda adds on. "I want to go back to being my cute normal self, and not have to put so much effort into things."

"I see." Byleth said with a slight nod. "However, I don't think you two thought this out as well as you think you did, which leaves me a little disappointed due to how Claude is supposed to be very intelligent."

"Oh?" Claude inquired, raising an eyebrow.

"You sabotaged the body I'm in, just to get your way, not considering how I could just switch one of you two into here when the vomiting starts, or just swap you into other bodies, how do you think Sylvain would react if he suddenly found himself in your body, Hilda?" Byleth explained, to which Hilda went pale, looking like he was about to freak, or vomit herself.

"So, are you going to do that?" Claude asked, growing nervous, especially when Byleth, someone known for always being serious, gave a wicked grin.

---

The forms of Rhea and Seteth were sitting facing each other, and talking, when they heard a knock on the door.

"Oh your archbishopness. It's time to start the day.". A guy's sing songy voice came through the door.

"I'll get that for you, Lady Rhea." Seteth said as he got up, and went to open the door. Claude and Hilda were standing there still in each other's bodies with big smiles on their faces, before looking surprised to see Seteth there as well. Hilda's body was wearing a pink maid outfit with a large bustle under the skirt. While Claude's body was wearing a golden yellow tailored suit.

"Oh, Seteth, we weren't expecting you, we were just coming to be take part in the holiday as the maid and butler for Lady Rhea due to the lottery drawing." Hilda said, shifting a little to cover his surprise.

"Lady Rhea wished to discuss something with me, so I stopped by for a bit." Seteth answered. Byleth happened to notice Claude discretely looking around, obviously trying to figure out where whatever Byleth was holding the real Rhea in was at, which Byleth had previously take precautions to have her hidden.

"Well, I've already prepared breakfast for her." Claude replied, halting the search to try to keep from seeming too suspicious as she stepped away slightly, and wheeled in a cart with a metal dish cover on it.

Searching within herself, Sothis remembered an old power she had. It was one of the goddess' most powerful abilities, to rewrite the world itself. The goddess had never used it before and even she had to admit she wasn't completely certain what would happen to her and Byleth if she used it

Although she had treated him rudely most of the time, Sothis had an admiration of Byelth and didn't want him to deal with the consequences of what she had done. However, she knew if Byleth were told about this power he would refuse to let her use it. So she didn't ask permission, this wasn't mischief, this was the goddess trying to help her best friend in her own special way.

As the goddess used this new power, she felt the current world fade away, and her vision got dark, like she was going to take a long nap

--------

The next morning Ingrid woke up to the rising of the sun. "Oh shoot, I'm going to be late!" She said as she began to go through her morning routine. She made sure to take some extra time to brush her hair, blonde but with strands of dark blue. Once she was ready for the day she rushed to class, carrying many papers.

Arriving at the classroom, the entire class was there before her "Sorry I'm late again everyone" she said with the memory of being late for class two days ago

"No problem, teach! We can do just fine without an extra five minutes of your nagging!" Claude gave a thumbs up, finally back to his own body

Ingrid gave a glare "Just for that you can spend an extra hour practicing your seord skills"

Ingrid looked at the lesson plans she had prepared for the day. Being the youngest teacher in the history of the monastery wasn't an easy task, but she loved her current life. As she looked over at Annette in Ignatz's body she blushed, remembering that night at the ball. She had to focus on teaching.

The world itself had been altered by Sothis, the man known as Byleth didn't exist in this new reality. Instead Byleth's mind and Ingrid's had been merged together, as well as their lives. No one had expected knight trainee Ingrid to become a teacher at such a young age, but after saving Claude, Dimitri, and Edelgard from a bandit attack she was assigned to that position. Her current personality was not that of Byleth's or of Ingrid's, but rather the two of them had become one person

As Ingrid went through and gave the class their assignments for the day, she noticed that it was awfully quiet. Like someone was missing.

Then, as if a memory she had forgotten had reemerged, she thought of a certain name "Sothis?" She questioned, not knowing why she thought of the goddess Sothis' name

A very tired voice spoke in the back of the mind "What is it?" The voice sounded weak

Upon hearing this voice, a strange set of memories began to form in Ingrid's mind. This was the goddess Sothis, occupying her body. She had met tge goddess months ago and awakened to the power of divine pulse. What was strange though was although Ingrid had these memories, she also remembered not having them

The remaking of the world wasn't perfect, it was bound to not be. Sothis had done it on the fly, anomalies like Annette and Ignatz being in each other's bodies were bound to happen. As well as Ingrid's current memories

However, something more important than memories were in Ingrid's mind "Are you okay Sothis? You sound weak"

"I'll be fine." Sothis said doing her best to sound strong "Just, don't use Divine Pulse or Transference for a day.....or a week.....I need a nap" and with that the goddess went quiet again

5 Years Later

Ingrid smiled as she looked down on Garreg Moch from atop her pegasus. It had been a long 5 years. Many battles were fought and won thanks to the strength of her students and friends. But now was not a time of wars and bloodshed, it was time to celebrate. It was the 1000 year anniversary of the founding of Garreg Moch and Ingrid and her friends agreed to meet on this day to once again spend time together, and it had been a while.

Claude had gone on to take on the role of leader of the Leicester Alliance working closing with Hilda along the way, after all since their time at the monastery the two were practically inseparable and the two of them together had managed to negotiate peace between all three of the governing bodies of Fodlan.

But that didn't mean everything was hunky dory. There were factions of unhappy groups across all of Fodlan and Claude and Rhea entrusted Professor Ingrid with the task of shutting them down. With her army of Golden Deer (along with a few recruits from the other houses) Ingrid would take down the opposing forces without a single loss on her side.

Although a part of that was the power of the Divine Pulse. Sothis didn't seem to really speak up much to Ingrid most of the time, she always seemed out of energy after she expended most of her powers to help create the new Ingrid, but when he chips were down in battle Ingrid was able to call upon the Divine Pulse to save the day.

But while Ingrid was confident in all things on the battlefield, there was one thing the Holy Hero Knight of Fodlan still got nervous about. After her time as Professor at Garreg Moch, Ingrid began dating one of her former students/friends. The two had been happily together for a while, but tonight at the millennium festival, Ingrid had a feeling her significant other was going to propose. Ingrid got butterflies in her stomach just thinking about this, but she brushed it off as she came in for a landing. She seemed to be the first one back at the monastery so she spent some time wandering around the campus for old times sake before finally ending up beside the Goddess Tower where a certain someone was already waiting for her.

Annette had decided to go with a name change that would match her new body, and she didn't feel right just taking Ignatz name, so she became Andrew. Andrew was wearing a green version of the academies male formal wear, although she had a blue cape to go along with it.

Ever the gentleman, Andrew came over and helped Ingrid off of her pegasus. "Well well, you're actually the first one here for once. At least I won't have to go to your room and wake you up this time around." Ingrid said making fun of her favorite former student.

1251113213111321223133221421312221112.content:
Byleth had never felt more awkward in his life. Ignatz and Byleth were dancing a slow dance together with arms outstretched and next to no touching. Their dancing was so awkward it was drawing a few giggles from the other students. Sylvain was at the food table with Lorenz both laughing at the awkward dance partially to compensate for neither getting a date for the ball. Claude and Hilda who were off in their own corner still in each other's bodies were deciding if they needed to step in and help out the awkward couple or not.

Byleth who could see the look of pure terror in Ignatz face decided it was time to take charge, "Come on, let's get out of here." He said, he figured a change of scenery without a room full of people looking at him would help Ignatz out and not scar him for life. Byleth grabbed Ignatz's hand and led the lime haired boy out of the side exit.

It was nice and quiet outside of main hall. The cool night air gave both young people room to breath and finally think more clearly again. "I'm sorry Ingrid," Ignatz said, "I shouldn't have even asked you to the dance. I don't know what I was thinking."

Byleth couldn't stand to see Ignatz beat himself up like this, he was such a sweet boy who just got overwhelmed by the moment, "No, no, it's perfectly fine. I think we can both agree that a dance like that just isn't for either of us."

"Yeah I guess. But I really was looking forward to dancing with you. I even asked Hilda for some dancing tips last night after she won the Cup. And I couldn't even remember any of what she said when I was out there with you, I was just too nervous."

Byleth chuckled inadvertently at the thought of Claude in Hilda's body being a dance instructor but this chuckle was taken badly. "Oh, yeah, I know it was dumb for someone like me to try and dance. I'll just leave and we can pretend this never happened." Ignatz said and he ran off towards the church before Byleth could stop him.

"Wait!" Byleth said and began to chase, but thanks to his heels and dress Ignatz managed to get out of Byleth's sight. Byleth took the heels off and searched the church half of the grounds and after about 15 minutes managed to find Ignatz. He had his painting supplies out and was painting the Goddess Tower by moonlight. Byleth breathed a sigh of relief "There you are!" Byleth said catching Ignatz off guard, "I was worried sick about you."

"I'm sorry Ingrid, I can't even break off a date ri..."

"Stop it!" Byleth said shutting Ignatz down. "You will not talk down about yourself any more. You are a fine and handsome young man who shouldn't care about what other people think. If you want to dance you should dance. Any girl would be lucky to have you. I care about you and can't stand to see you like this. You're amazing in so many ways. You're the best archer in the academy. You're art is absolutely stunning. I mean look at this thing." Byleth walked up to Ignatz Goddess Tower portrait. "This thing is off to an amazing start and you've only had, what, 15 minutes to work on it? You are one of the most amazing people I know so stop doubting yourself!"

Ignatz stood stunned at Byleth's words forming from Ingrid's mouth, "Wow, you really think all of those things?"

"Of course I do, how could I not?" Byleth said and before either realized it, Byleth was giving Ignatz a big hug.

"Ingrid..." Ignatz said, and without speaking he looked into Ingrid's eyes and kissed her with a surprising amount of passion. The stunned Byleth froze as Ignatz broke the kiss and began to ramble. "Ingrid you are so beautiful and smart and I just always knew these things but the last day has shown me how smart and caring a person you are. I thought I liked you before, but I just want to spend more time with you now. I want to be your knight. I want to fight for you. No, that's not right. I want to be a knight WITH you. I want to fight at your side. I've never been more sure of anything."

"Ignatz I..." Byleth said at a complete loss for words.

The more confident Ignatz didn't run away in shame this time, with an air of confidence he said, "Think about what I said, I meant every word. Let me know if you feel in any way the same. I'll, um, see you." As he left he turned and said, "Oh, and the picture is for you. I hope you like it."

Byleth picked up the picture Ignatz had just finished and looked up at the real subject matter. "Stupid Goddess Tower. What the hell am I going to do now?"

Meanwhile in the shadows of the church watching everything from afar, Sothis, still in Dorathea's body smiled at what she just saw, "Well well, things just got more interesting."

Itsuki was always hanging around the theater, so swapping him with her would be easy. She also had no current responsibilities so her could relax.

With Reiji's arms getting tired from holding the whiteboard, Seijuro chose to...

The woman said, "I'd be happy to help! What are you looking for?"

Ren said, "Oh I'm not really sure right now. Do you have any suggestions?"

The woman said, "Please follow me." She led Ren to the children's department normally he'd be upset, but considering the body he now had children clothes was a necessity. He can't walk around like a prison warden all day.

The woman said, "I have a couple suggestions. I think a tom boy look would do wonders for you or I'd suggest a cute skirt or dress. Let me grab what I'm thinking about." The woman left to go find the clothes she mentioned. After a few minute she returned with some options.

In her left hand was a cute dress with a pink top half and a dark blue bottom half with two ribbons in the back. She also had light purple stockings with a pair of boots.

In her right hand was a light green tank top with a cute pair of green short shorts and a pair of black boots.

Ren looked at the two options she had. The dress was as far away she can get from the prison warden attire. That was her original plan, but the short shorts could be very embarrassing as well. She didn't know when she'd switch back, but she wanted to be comfortable during her time with this body.

"You said you had something to show me?" she asked.
"Yeah, its upstairs" Ren quickly replied before leading her into the attic that was his room.

In his room, he retrieved the remote and its instructions before presenting them to Makoto. Reading through the damaged note, her brow became increasingly furrowed.
"Are you sure this is real? It seems so ludicrous" she said with a half-laugh.
"That's why I called you here. I want to test if it's real or not. The Metaverse seems ludicrous as well but that's real so why not this?" Ren replied.
"You do have a point. We should test it out then." Makoto declared, smiling. "Aware swap should be first function to test then." Makoto then pressed the button twice,
first targetting herself then targetting Ren.

In an instant, Ren's perspective shifted from standing up to being sat down. Additionally, his body felt completely different. Of course it felt different; it wasn't his body. The remote had worked.
"Wow." Ren heard his own voice speak as he looked up at his own body, knowing that it was Makoto in control. "This...This is unprecedented." She was completely in shock as she held up her current hands, inspecting her hands. Quickly, she then looked at Ren in her own body, still shocked. "Is that you, Ren?" He nodded. "So it does work, then." she stated as her shock vanished. She then approached the remote and picked it up before reverting the swap.

Now back in their original bodies, they back discussing the remote and what it could do. "How does this device work, I wonder?" Makoto absently-mindedly said as she inspected it. "There don't seem to be any negative side effects of its use so it seems ok to use but is it connected to the Metaverse in any way?" she said as she placed the remote down. [Originally written by Reset (scratch495@Writing.Com)]

Yu stretched his arms over his head as he walked down into the Dojima family's living room. He looked forward to the lazy sunday ahead of him now that he and his friends had seemingly captured the killer responsible for the chaos in Inaba, a teen from a different school by the name of Mitsuo. There had been several murders and even more kidnappings, but with the crisis out of the way he could live like a normal highs-chooler and enjoy the rest of the year.


"Hey big bro," a soft voice rang out from the living room as Yu was putting on his shoes. "A package arrived for you today." Sitting by the TV, Yu's little cousin Nanako was point towards a small box left out on the kitchen counter for him.


Yu raised an eyebrow. "Doesn't look like its from Tanaka..." He put in a lot of orders for items useful to his investigations and forays into the midnight channel with the rest of the investigation team, but he couldn't recall making one recently. Curious, he opened up the box, seeing a small device decked out with 4 buttons and a leaflet with soe basic instructions.


'Well, that looks like a lot of nonsense,' Yu remakred mentally as he read the notes with a blank expression. 'But then, this whole year has been a lot of nonsense.' Body swapping was of course, impossible, but Yu had reason to be more credulous than the average person. After all, he could phase through televisions and fought monsters on a regular basis.


"Guess I owe it to whoever sent it to give it a shot, even if it is an elaborate joke," Yu honestly couldn't imagine who might've sent it to him, but it'd be mean to deprive the prankster of their fun.


"Is that for your TV upstairs?" Nanako asked from across the room, having been watching silently the whole time Yu read the instructions.


Yu shrugged, "I guess you could say that." It was best not to go into detail before you could prove something; otherwise people don't really believe you. He knew that from experience.


'If I want to test it, I suppose Nanako is right here,' Yu reasoned absently. She was a smart kid, and he knew she would keep a secret if he asked her too. Still, if it worked, it might be best to keep knowledge of it confined to the investigation team. They already knew the supernatural was real, so it'd be less likely to shatter their worldview. There wasn't much to do in Inaba on your own, so Yu figured that basically any of his friends would be available right now

15533331211.content:
[Originally written by Reset (Scratch495@writing.com)]

It was a rather reckless option, but as far Yu could see, neither was likely to work, so he instinctively went for the Aware Swap option.


"Hey Nanako, hold still while I try something," Yu said abruptly as he pointed the remote at her and clicked the button. A sudden burst of nausea overtook him as the room seemed to spin around and his perspective became much, much smaller.


"Try what?" Yu heard his own voice ask, as he found himself sitting down on the other side of the room. Standing by the counter, he saw his own body looking at him like a deer in headlights. "...uh, big bro...?" There was a brief clatter as Nanako dropped the remote.


A quick downward glance confirmed for Yu that the remote worked. He pulled up a pair of small, delicate hands to his eyes, and looking past those hands he saw his legs were exposed - he was wearing Nanako's dress.


Thankfully, Yu was quick on his feet. He had spent this whole year involved in stranger things than this. While his balance was off, he managed to pull himself to his feet. "Don't worry Nanako - it's me. Everything will be fine," he assured his cousin in his own body as he stood up, his balance more than a bit off center. If the remote switched them so easily, it'd switch them back just as easily. However, the issue of 'damage control' still remained. Yu had enough experience to deal with this, but how would he explain this to Nanako?


"Big bro, are you me?"


Remembering the clattering sound after they switched, Yu realized that Nanako - who was now looking herself over with a sense of awe - didn't really process the remote. He could try explaining everything to her, but it might lead to... issues. If he could get a hold of it without her realizing though, there was a chance he could switch them back without Nanako knowing about the device at all and just play dumb about it. Maybe she'd think it was a dream? Or just some magical event like in a movie? He knew he had to commit before her sense of awe turned into panic though.

"Nothing useful here" Nanako sighed, she was about to throw the manual away when she noticed some tiny print on the last page open the back

Nanako smiled, could this be the ray of hope she was praying for? She opened the back and found another new set of buttons

Four new buttons were what greeted her. A 'Command', 'Memory Swap', 'Life Swap', 'Clothes Swap', and 'Personality Swap'. Nanako frowned, sure these new buttons were neat but she was hoping for something the could instantly solve the problem, like a Reset Button or something.

There was also nothing on these buttons indicating whether or not the swaps they aould produce would be of the Aware or Unaware variety. Nanako snuck over to Yu's room to test things out. She hit the clothes swap button, however instead of registering a target like the buttons had done before, it merely lit up.

Nanako was confused at first, but had a good feeling on what this meant, she then pressed the Aware Swap button. In an instant she was wearing the blue dress that Yu was wearing. So these 4 buttons could be Aware or Unaware swaps, depending on the user's choice.

Nanako sighed as she swapped clothes back. If only there was an Age Swap button so they could get back to normal, but it seemed that was a complete fluke when the remote malfunctioned earlier

She looked at Yu sleeping and wondered, so I do some more swaps? The temptation to use the remote was there and she had a sleeping target. After some deliberation she decided
1553333121112123112122131.title: She read the manual

15533331211121231121221312.content:
She debated on what to do. She had hoped the manual would offer a solution to the current situation. She didn't know what to do to fix this! She had to find some way to returned everyone to normal. What should she do? She began biting her lip avoiding the desire to cry about the problem she had caused just because she wanted to have some fun. An idea crossed her mind. The memory and personality swap! She could switch her memories and personality with her big brother! Surely if she had his memories and personality she could figure things out!

She quickly pressed the memory and personality swap button on the back and aimed it at her sleeping big brother. She went for the aware swap button, but she had been so excited about her plan she didn't think about the possible consequences or noticed her finger slip and press the unaware swap. She felt a wave of dizziness strike her mind as new memories and thoughts crossed into her mind. She lost her balance and caught herself on the table nearby.

Some of the biggest memories to stick out were of the TV world everyone fighting to save others. Her big...brother something about it felt off calling Yu that. Another memory was of his first kiss! Her big brother was dating Yukiko! They were looking forward to playing with her at the beach. After those memories came up Nanako felt her mind calm down panicking would not do anyone any good. She couldn't figure out anything on the top of her head on how to fix this. Maybe she needed to sleep for tonight. She could figure things out after school. She made sure she still had the remote and made her way to her big brother's room.

----
The next morning Nanako woke up to a familiar voice calling up to him...was that right?
"Big Sis! Breakfast is ready!"
Nanako quickly got ready for school and grabbed the remote to pack into their bag. She saw Yu sitting down eating some eggs and toast happily.

They smiled, "Morning Big Sis! I hope you like my breakfast! I would've made more, but I have to leave early today help set up in class. I'll see you after school! Then maybe we can play at Junes!" Yu finished her meal and began leaving the house. Nanako felt like something about that was strange. Was Yu always that cheerful? Of course they were. That's how her little sister was.

She quickly finished off her breakfast and made her way outside and was greeted by Kanji and Yukiko who looked uncomfortable.

Kanji said, "Uh morning Senpai. How are you doing this morning?"

Yukiko said shyly, "Morning Yu. Did you sleep well?" Something about Kanji's body acting shy looked so wrong.

Nanako said, "I slept well enough. How about you two?"

Kanji said, "Er...it was...something."

Yukiko said, "We were hoping you could switch us back before school. You did a bit of research after we left right?"

Nanako said, "Er...I did what I could. Are you sure you want to risk it? What if we get a similar situation to Chie and Yukiko?"

Kanji said, "Damn it I'd rather take that risk than just go to school like this. I'm a first year there is no way I can pass as Yukiko in class especially someone at the top of the class."

Nanako sighed they had a point and Kanji being in Yukiko's body really bugged him a lot for a few reasons.

Nanako said, "Alright but don't say I didn't warn you." She fired off the aware swap at the two of them and waited to see what happens
